column5: Holy...
Well Done ! All that hard work paid off big time
Awesome fish for southern ON!!! Well done.
Wow beauty man!
2nd shot is great, nice fish, congrats.
Well done!!.. I have yet to break the 40 inch mark for Pike... Def not an easy task!!
Nice fish!!
Very nice congrats that is a trophy for sure
Thanks for the replies everyone, it was a great fish for sure.  Brian, no I wont be at Cabelas.  Not working anyways lolHere's a few more of the beauts I've landed this year.
Wow, that is an impressive collection of gators. 47" is incredible!  Pete
Wow, what a beauty.  Congrats!
Awesome fish...

Hey folks, it's been a while since I've posted, but I've been out fishing a bit.  This year has offered a tough season for the big pike that I love so much.  I've been able to boat some real quality fish, but I've had to work very hard for them thus far.  I'm not going to flood the post with photos from the season but I would really like to share a fish that I caught and released this past Friday.  I'd been finding some quality pike transitioning from their shallow sunning grounds out into the deeper feeding zones, but after numerous follows throwing bucktails, and nothing commiting, I needed to change tactics.  I downsized to a 5 inch Imperium Ace soft jerkbait rigged on a 6/0 Trokar straight shank worm hook, tied directly to a steel leader.  I was able to boat a few in the 30-36 inch range before hooking up with the biggest pike of my life to date.  I hit this fish in about 9 feet of water and she absolutely crushed it.  Say hello to my PB, a 47 inch gator!  It may be a while before I top this one in Southern Ontario.
DAMN!  Nice job!!!!
Holy crap that second shot really shows the size of the fish!  Well done!!  Burt
Omg!  Absolutely huge!
remind me not to go swimming in that lake!!
Nice job, there dirty things but if you can find them in in the 40's sure are fun to catch! Nice job Steve great PB unreal
Wow.  Congrats, what a beauty
What a fish!!!,closing on 50",congrats,a memory I'm sure you soon won't forget.
Very nice ! Congrats !
Wow a monster.  A true giant pike.  Nice catch.
Awesome fish congrats!
Nicely done, Thx for the details
absolutely amazing fish. I'm with everyone else, that second picture really shows this beasts true size

That is an albatross for Southern Ontario, an incredible accomplishment. Congratulations.
